document.masterDocTitle: New genera, species and occurrence records of Goniasteridae (Asteroidea; Echinodermata) from the Indian Ocean

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New genera, species and occurrence records of Goniasteridae (Asteroidea; Echinodermata) from the Indian Ocean

bibRefCitation.author: Mortensen, T.
bibRefCitation.refString: Mortensen, T. (1925) On some echinoderms from South Africa. Annals and Magazines of Natural History, 9, 16 (91), 14 - 154. https: // doi. org / 10.1080 / 00222932508633280

subSubSection.paragraph: Comments. Observations of this species from Madagascar , the Mascarene Islands, the Mayotte Islands, and Reunion Island show variation in inferomarginal spine morphology. Madagascar specimens display welldeveloped, cylindrical spines with blunt, quadrate flattened tips. Specimens from the Mascarene Islands and off the Mayotte Islands show inferomarginal spines with conical, pointed tips. Reunion Island specimens show more weakly developed tubercle-like pointed inferomarginal spines.
One specimen, IE-2007-1173 showed significant sublethal damage in the interradial region.

Macan (1938: 402) outlined the color of this species with a “white” abactinal surface “with a fine reticulation of carnelian red between the plates.” Deck shots of this species by BIOMAGLO show individuals as a bright yellow with speckled red highlights.
Occurrence. South Africa , off the coast of Natal. Zanzibar channel, Reunion Island, Mascarene Islands, Madagascar , north of Mayotte Island 183–490 m (depth range extended)
